intro: Linum perenne subsp. austriacum, commonly known as the Austrian flax, is a perennial herb native to Central Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its fibrous stems and seeds have historical uses in textile production and as a source of oil.
